result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald H. Zache was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sell/Possess/Manufacture MolotovCocktail, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.06(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 11:02am[MO]
Defendant Donald H. Zache in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance
Arguments given by Counsel
Statement given by Mr. Zache

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 20  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on 3/6/2015 at 7:00pm
--0 days credit for time already served given
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--pay costs of  $268 plus 250 DNA surcharge= $518,  to be paid in $40 per month installments commencing on 3/26/15 and on the 26th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 11 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

Case called at 1:46 pm
Defendant Donald H. Zache in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No presence at the residence of Dalton Yeadon-Stark
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Dalton Yeadon-Stark or DAS (DOB:1/5/1999)

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause.

Recess: 1:50 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 9/17/14 at 1:20 pm
Preliminary Hearing: to be set
